welcome.heading: Join the Road with SSP
welcome.description: Your digital onboarding platform for joining SSP Truck Line. Complete your hiring documents quickly and securely.

language.title: Multi-language
language.description: Available in English, Spanish, and French to serve all drivers comfortably

security.title: Secure & Safe
security.description: Your information is protected with enterprise-grade security and encryption

steps.title: 6-Step Process
steps.description: Complete all required hiring documents through our guided 6-stage form wizard

start.heading: Start Your Application
start.subheading: Begin your journey with SSP Group of Companies
start.ensureDoc: Please ensure you have the documents listed below to complete this application process
start.agreeToTerms: I agree to the Terms & Conditions and Privacy Policy

termsModal.title: Terms & Conditions
termsModal.intro: Please review the terms below. To continue, confirm your agreement.

points.accurateInfo: All information I provide will be accurate and truthful.
points.digitalProcess: I understand this is a digital application and that records may be stored electronically.
points.selfApplication: I confirm that this application is being completed by me personally and not for or on behalf of another person.
points.truthfulInfo: I confirm that all information I submit is true and accurate.
points.applicationType: I acknowledge my selected application type (contractor or employee) in this application.
points.rulesTitle: I understand and agree to the following company rules:
points.safetyRules: Speed limits (105 km/h), incident reporting, and no phone use while driving
points.seals: Trailer seals and cross-border inspection requirements
points.laws: I am responsible for complying with Canadian and U.S. trucking laws.

termsModal.masterConsent: I have read and agree to the Terms & Conditions listed above.

policiesModal.title: Policies & Data Usage Notice
policiesModal.sub-title: As part of your application to become a driver with One of our many companies, we collect and use certain personal information to confirm your qualifications and comply with legal and safety requirements.

whatInfoItems.itemTwo: Driver‚Äôs licence details and driving record (abstract)
whatInfoItems.itemFour: Results of background checks and drug/alcohol testing

whyInfoItems.itemOne: To verify you meet legal requirements for commercial driving
whyInfoItems.itemTwo: To ensure workplace and road safety
whyInfoItems.itemThree: To complete background and employment checks as required by law
whyInfoItems.itemFour: To maintain accurate employment and compliance records

section.whoInfo: Who has access to this information

whoInfoItems.itemOne: Company's Human Resources and Compliance teams
whoInfoItems.itemTwo: Regulatory authorities (e.g., Transport Canada; FMCSA if cross-border)
whoInfoItems.itemThree: Authorized third parties (e.g., background check providers, insurers)

section.howLong: How long we keep your information
section.duration: Your information will be securely stored for the period required by law (typically 3‚Äì7 years, depending on document type and jurisdiction).

company.heading: Join Our Family of Companies
company.subheading: Choose the company where you want to build your driving career
company.selectTypeDesc: Please choose the type of position you are applying for:

descriptions.ssp-ca: Leading transportation solutions across Canada with specialized freight services
descriptions.ssp-us: Premier freight solutions across the United States with cross-border coverage
descriptions.fellowtrans: Reliable freight solutions with a focus on customer satisfaction
descriptions.webfreight: Modern logistics solutions powered by technology and innovation
descriptions.nesh: Specialized steel and heavy materials transportation across North America

pending.title: Application Pending Approval
pending.subtitle: Thank you for starting your application with SSP Group of Companies.
pending.body1: We have received your application. Our team is currently reviewing your information.
pending.body2: Once your application is approved, you will receive an email with the next steps.
pending.tip: You can close this page now and check back later, or refresh once you believe you‚Äôve been approved. Also keep an eye on your inbox (and spam/junk folder) for our email.

approved.title: Application Approved
approved.subtitle: Great news! Your application has been approved.
approved.body1: You can proceed to the next step of your onboarding now.
approved.body2: Click the button below to continue your application.

form.subtitle: All information must be answered truthfully. Liability falls on the applicant.

helpPopups.page2SafetySensitive:
As part of our regulatory compliance process, please confirm the following information:

Cross-Border Driving: Please indicate "Yes" if you have previously operated a commercial vehicle across the U.S.‚ÄìCanada border. If not, please indicate "No."

DOT-Regulated Drug Testing: Please indicate "Yes" if your previous employer conducted drug and alcohol testing in accordance with U.S. Department of Transportation (DOT) regulations. If not, please indicate "No."

Your responses help us ensure compliance with applicable transportation and safety regulations. If you have any questions or need clarification, feel free to reach out.
helpPopups.page3CanadianHours:
As part of the Hours of Service (HOS) compliance requirements under Canadian regulations, please provide the number of on-duty hours (including driving) you completed in the last 14 days with your previous employer.

Kindly ensure the following:
‚Ä¢ Indicate the number of hours worked for each day in the 14-day period.
‚Ä¢ Include the total hours worked over the entire 14 days.
‚Ä¢ If you were on vacation, off-duty, or did not work on any day, please indicate that by entering "0" or "nil" for that day.

This information is essential for us to accurately track your compliance with Canadian HOS rules. Thank you for your cooperation.

questions.over23Local: Are you over the age of 23 (for Local)?
questions.over25CrossBorder: Are you over the age of 25 (for Cross Border)?
questions.experienceDrivingTractorTrailer: Do you have at least 2 years of verifiable experience driving Tractor/Trailer?
questions.faultAccidentIn3Years: Do you have any at-fault accident in the past 3 years?
questions.zeroPointsOnAbstract: Do you have more than 0 points on your driver‚Äôs abstract?
questions.noUnpardonedCriminalRecord: Do you have any criminal record for which pardon has not been granted?
questions.legalRightToWorkCanada: Do you have legal right to work in Canada?
questions.legalRightToWorkUS: Do you have legal right to work in the US?
questions.statusInCanada: What is your status in Canada?
questions.canCrossBorderUSA: Can you cross borders into USA?
questions.hasFASTCard: Do you have a FAST card?
questions.eligibleForFASTCard: Are you eligible for a FAST card?
questions.driverType: Which type of driver are you?
questions.teamStatus: Are you part of a team or driving solo?

flatbedPopup.title: Notice
flatbedPopup.yes: Your flatbed skill level will be tested during the Drive Test.
flatbedPopup.no: After your Drive Test, you will be enrolled in a 2-week flatbed training.

address.title: Address History
address.subtitle: Please provide your address history for the past 5 years

fields.sinPhotoDesc: Click to capture or select an image
fields.canProvideProof: Can you provide proof of age?
fields.licensePhotoDesc: Click to capture or select an image

confirmation.title: Please Confirm
confirmation.message: You are about to submit your personal details to SSP Group of Companies for review. Once submitted, our Safety Department will review your application. If approved, you will receive an email with instructions on how to continue your onboarding process. Do you want to proceed?

page2.requirements: The Federal Motor Carrier Safety Regulations (49CFR391.21) require that all applicants wishing to drive a commercial vehicle must provide employment history for the last ten (10) years. Any 1 month or more gaps in employment must be explained.

questions.workedWithCompanyBefore: Have you ever worked (Under Sub-contractor) with this company previously?
questions.reasonForLeavingCompany: What was the reason for leaving the company?
questions.expectedRateOfPay: What is your expected rate of pay?

fields.subjectToFMCSR: Were you subject to FMCSR (Federal Motor Carrier Safety Regulations)?
fields.safetySensitiveFunction: Was your job designated as a safety sensitive function in any DOT regulated mode subject to the drug and alcohol testing requirement of 49 CFR part 40.

modal.title: Additional Employment History Required
modal.message: You must provide 10 years of employment history. Please add your previous employment history to complete the required information.

page2.gapDetected: Gap of {days} days detected between employments. Please explain:

page3.instructionsCanadianHours: INSTRUCTIONS: Motor carriers when using a driver for the first time or intermittently shall obtain from the driver a signed statement giving the driver's total time on ‚Äìduty during the immediately preceding 14 days and time at which such driver was last relieved from duty prior to beginning work for such carrier (see Section 395.8(j)(2) Federal Motor Carrier Safety Regulations). NOTE: Hours for any compensated work during the preceding 14 days, including work for a non- motor carrier entity, must be recorded on this form.
page3.instructionsAccidentHistory: Please provide details of any accidents history you have been involved. If you have no accidents to report, you may leave all fields empty.
page3.instructionsTrafficConvictions: Please provide details of any traffic convictions you have received forfeitures, and Warnings for the past three years (other than parking violations). If you have no convictions to report, you may leave all fields empty.
page3.instructionsEducation: Please indicate the number of years completed in each education level. Select 0 if you did not attend that level.

fields.natureOfAccident: Nature of Accident (Head-on, Rear end, upset, NAF, etc...

criminalRecords.title: Criminal Record Verification
criminalRecords.subtitle: Applicants must declare all convictions for offenses under Canadian federal law.

guidance.intro: Please read the following carefully before completing this section:

items.item1: A conviction for which you have received a Record Suspension (formerly pardon) in accordance with the Criminal Records Act;
items.item2: A conviction where you were a 'young person' under the Youth Criminal Justice Act;
items.item3: An Absolute or Conditional Discharge, pursuant to section 730 of the Criminal Code;
items.item4: An offense for which you were not convicted;
items.item5: Any provincial or municipal offense; and
items.item6: Any charges dealt with outside of Canada.

disclaimer.text: If you provide any incorporation detail, you must complete every field and upload all related documents in this section. This includes HST Number, Business Name, and the required photos (Incorporation, HST).

banking.title: Banking Information
banking.requiredDisclaimer: Banking information is required for Company and Owner Operator applicants. Upload a clear photo of a void cheque or a bank-issued direct deposit form showing your name, institution number, transit number, and account number.
banking.optionalDisclaimer: Banking information is optional for Owner Drivers. If you choose to provide it now, upload a clear photo of a void cheque or a bank-issued direct deposit form that shows your name, institution number, transit number, and account number so payroll can set up your direct deposit.

fastCard.title: FAST Card
fastCard.disclaimer: This section is optional. However, if you provide any FAST Card information, you must complete all fields and upload both front and back photos.

eligibilityDocs.title: Health / Identification Documents
eligibilityDocs.description: Please provide clear and readable photos of the required health and identity documents listed below. All details must be visible (front and back where applicable). If any document is missing or unclear, your application may be delayed.

fields.denied: Have you ever been denied a license, permit or privilege to operate a motor vehicle?
fields.suspended: Has any license, permit or privilege ever been suspended or revoked?
fields.testedPositive: Have you ever tested positive, or refused to test, on any pre-employment drug or alcohol test administered by an employer to which you applied for, but did not obtain, safety-sensitive transportation work covered by DOT agency drug and alcohol testing rules during the past two years?
fields.completedDOT: If you answered YES, can you provide/obtain proof that you‚Äôve successfully completed the DOT return-to-duty requirements?
fields.hasInsurance: Do you have your own Accidental Benefit Insurance Coverage?

accidentalInsurancePopup.title: Company Insurance Registration
accidentalInsurancePopup.message: For your safety and compliance, SSP Truck Line will register every driver under the company's Accident Benefit Insurance plan. This ensures you are fully covered while working, regardless of whether you already have your own personal accident benefit insurance. Your personal coverage, if any, remains unaffected ‚Äî but company registration is mandatory to provide consistent protection for all drivers.

fields.healthCardDescription: Upload clear photos of both the front and back of your health card (e.g., Ontario Health Card).
fields.passportTypeQuestion: What type of passport do you have?
fields.workAuthorizationTypeQuestion: What type of work authorization do you have?
fields.passportDescription: Upload the passport bio/data page (with your photo) and the back cover page (e.g., Canadian or foreign passport).
fields.passportDescriptionUS: Upload the passport bio/data page (with your photo) and the back cover page (e.g., US passport).
fields.usVisaDescription: Upload clear photos of your valid US visa (e.g., visitor, work, or study visa pages).
fields.prPermitCitizenshipDescription: Upload clear photos of your Permanent Resident card, Work/Study Permit, or Citizenship document (e.g., PR card front & back, Work Permit letter).
fields.greenCardCitizenshipDescription: Upload clear photos of your Permanent Resident card or US Citizenship document (e.g., PR card front & back, Certificate of Naturalization).
fields.medicalCertificationDescription: Upload clear photos of your valid DOT Medical Certificate (front and back if applicable).
fields.incorporatePhotosDescription: Upload clear photos of your business incorporation documents (e.g., Articles of Incorporation, Certificate of Incorporation).
fields.hstPhotosDescription: Upload a photo of your HST/GST business number registration document (e.g., CRA registration letter).
fields.bankingInfoPhotosDescription: Upload a photo of a void cheque or direct deposit form from your bank (must clearly show account number and institution details).

page5.title: Competency Test
page5.lockedNote: You have submitted your answers. The test is now locked.
page5.note: I confirm I have reviewed my score and understand I cannot retake this test.
page5.reviewInstruction: Review your answers below. When ready, scroll down and check the acknowledgment box, then click Continue to proceed.

modal.confirmMessage: You cannot retake this competency test once submitted. Are you sure you want to proceed?

1.question: According to FMCSA, you may not drive for more than:

options.b: After being on duty for 14 hours
options.c: After being on duty for more than 8 hours following continuous 10 hours off duty

2.question: According to FMCSA, you may not work for more than how many hours in 8 days:

3.question: After 11 hours of driving time, you must

options.c: Get 10 consecutive hours of rest before driving again

4.question: During pre-trip inspection, you must show that the

options.a: The vehicle is safe to drive
options.b: The vehicle is newer than 4 years
options.c: You are competent and have no alcohol in the system

5.question: Cognitive load while you drive refers to:

options.a: How much work your brain is doing
options.c: The number of hazards you can see

6.question: Using hands-free mode on a mobile device while driving:

7.question: During the pre-trip inspection, you will

options.a: Sit in the truck and drive around talking about your expertise
options.b: Take a computerized test about truck driving
options.c: Walk around the vehicle and point to or touch each item and explain to the examiner what you are checking and why

8.question: During pre-trip inspection, the mirror and windscreen should be checked for

10.question: If a driver finds trailer‚Äôs seal broken at a truck stop, he must

options.b: Re-inspect his equipment for any suspicious behavior

11.question: When a driver receives notice of license or permits revocation/suspension he/she must

options.b: Notify the carrier within a week
options.d: Take no action since the carrier will get notification

12.question: The maximum legal gross weight a tandem combination is permitted in the US:

13.question: You may reset your 70-hour cycle by having at least how many hours off duty in Canada:

14.question: A driver may not drive faster than the posted speed limit

options.a: Unless the driver is sick and must complete the run quickly to see a doctor
options.c: During the day as you can see things clearly
options.d: Unless the driver is late and is making for the time lost

15.question: Empty trailers crossing borders do not require bolt seal.

16.question: Who should be putting the seal on the trailer?

17.question: A general rule for any inspection point during a security inspection is to look for:

18.question: The last step of affixing a security seal to a trailer or container is to:

options.a: Pull down on the seal to confirm that it is secure
options.b: Twist the seal to see if it comes off
options.c: Double check the seal number matches your documentation

step3.title: Policies & Consents
step3.disclaimer: By signing below, you agree to all the contract here and future contracts. Please read all documents carefully. Your provided information will automatically prefill required fields.
step3.sendToEmail: Send me the documents to my email when the application process is complete.

helper.drawOrUpload: Please draw your signature above or upload a signature image.

messages.needSignature: Please draw or upload a signature before continuing.
messages.uploadFailed: Failed to upload your signature. Please try again.

instructions.header: You have reached the Drive Test stage of the application process.
instructions.contactSafety: Please speak with Safety department to begin your test.
instructions.passMessage: If you pass: You will proceed to Step 5 (Carrier's Edge Training).
instructions.failMessage: If you do not pass: A decision would be made on either equipping you with additional training or terminating your application.
instructions.note: Note: Based on your performance, if you are required to have flatbed driving experience and you do not have this skill yet, you may also be assigned Yard Training (Step 7) to further develop your driving skills. If you never had experience to begin with, then you will have Yard Training by default.

success.title: Congratulations! üéâ
success.message: You have successfully completed your Drive Test! Your driving skills have been evaluated and approved. Next Step: You will now proceed to (Step 5) Carrier's Edge Training to complete your onboarding process.

instructions.header: Our Safety Team will send your login credentials for the CarriersEdge training to the following email:
instructions.completionRequired: Please complete the training in full on the CarriersEdge website. Completion is required before you can proceed to the next step of the hiring process.
instructions.nextStepInfo: Once completed, you will be able to proceed to the next step of your application.

emailSent.message: Your Carrier edge training test credential has been sent to your email {{email}} please visit your email and follow the instruction to complete your test.

completed.message: Congratulations on the completion of your test, you can now proceed to step 6 of the application process. Next Step: You will now proceed to (Step 6) Drug Test to complete your onboarding process.

step6.title: Drug Test
step6.description: Please upload clear photos of your drug test documents. You can add up to {{count}} photos. Once uploaded, documents will be verified before you can continue.
step6.pending: Documents uploaded. Pending verification. Uploads are disabled.
step6.rejected: Your drug test documents were rejected. Please re-upload and re-submit.

success.title: Congratulations! üéâ
success.message: You have successfully completed your Drug Test! Your documents have been verified and approved. You can now proceed to the next step of your onboarding process.

instructions.header: You have reached the Flatbed Training stage of the application process.
instructions.contactSafety: Please speak with Safety department to begin your flatbed training.
instructions.passMessage: If you pass: You will proceed to the next step of your onboarding process.
instructions.failMessage: If you do not pass: A decision would be made on either equipping you with additional training or terminating your application.
instructions.note: Note: This training is required for drivers who need flatbed driving experience. The Safety department will contact you to schedule your training session.

success.title: Congratulations! üéâ
success.message: You have successfully completed your Flatbed Training! Your flatbed driving skills have been evaluated and approved. You can now proceed to the next step of your onboarding process.

errors.minimum5Years: You must provide at least 5 years of address history.
errors.addressDurationError: Address provided should span for the last 5 years. Please add previous address if you lived in more than one location.

resume.title: Resume Your Application
resume.description: Enter your SIN/SSN to continue your onboarding from where you stopped.
resume.description_sin_only: Enter your SIN/SSN and we‚Äôll email a verification code to the address on file. Then enter the code to continue your onboarding.
resume.codeInstruction: Enter the 6-digit code sent to your email
resume.error: No application found for that SIN.
resume.sinChangedNeedsNewCode: SIN changed ‚Äî please send a new verification code for this SIN.

errors.generic: Could not resume application. Please try again.
errors.rateLimited: Please wait {{s}} seconds before requesting a new code.
errors.codeForDifferentSin: Please request a code for the current SIN first.

step1.label: 1. Pre-Qualification
step1.desc: Quick eligibility check (‚âà2 min): age, AZ licence, work eligibility (Canada/US), and basic readiness.

step2.label: 2. Application Form
step2.desc: 5-page form covering personal details, 5-year address history, licences & uploads, employment history, and declarations.

step3.label: 3. Policies
step3.desc: Review company policies and provide required acknowledgements/signatures.

step4.label: 4. Drive Test
step4.desc: Scheduling and results for road/in-yard evaluation (managed by Safety).

step5.label: 5. Carriers Edge
step5.desc: Complete assigned online safety training; we'll guide you to sign in.

step6.label: 6. Drug Test
step6.desc: If required, you'll receive instructions and a referral location.

step7.label: 7. Flatbed Training (If Required)
step7.desc: On-site flatbed training and evaluation for drivers who need this specialized skill.

saving.autoSignOut: Auto-logout for security: If there‚Äôs no activity for 10 minutes, the form will automatically return to the Welcome screen.
saving.progressSaves: Your progress is saved: Once you enter your SIN (Social Insurance Number)/SSN on page 2 and continue, your progress will be securely saved.
saving.resumeLater: Resume anytime: If you disconnect or switch devices, you can use your SIN and the Resume button on the Welcome screen to continue where you left off.
saving.privacyNote: Privacy note: Your SIN is used only to locate your application and is stored securely.

completion.title: Application Completed Successfully! üéâ
completion.message: Congratulations! You have successfully completed your driver onboarding application! Your application has been submitted and is now under review by our team. We will contact you soon with next steps.

nextSteps.title: What Happens Next?
nextSteps.message: Our team will review your application and contact you within 2-3 business days to discuss the next steps in your hiring process. Please keep your phone and email available for our team to reach you.

completion.resumeInfo: You can use your SIN/SSN to resume and view your completed application anytime from the home page.

session.title: Session Expired
session.message: Your session has expired for security after 6 hours of inactivity. Your progress is safely saved.

notFound.title: Application Not Found
notFound.message: Your application could not be found. This may happen if the application was terminated or has expired.

network.title: Connection Failed
network.message: Unable to connect to the server. Please check your internet connection and try again.

server.title: Server Error
server.message: Something went wrong on our end. Please try again or contact support if the problem persists.

rateLimit.title: Too Many Requests
rateLimit.message: You've made too many requests. We'll automatically retry in 30 seconds, or you can go home and try again later.
